# Eutrema edwardsii

| genus = Eutrema
| species = edwardsii
| authority = R.Br.
| synonyms_ref =
| synonyms =
*Eutrema edwardsii var. intermedium
*Eutrema intermedium
*Eutrema labradoricum
*Eutrema septigerum
*Sisymbrium edwardsii
*Smelowskia parviflora
*Thlaspi septigerum
}}}}
Eutrema edwardsii, called '''Edwards' mock wallflower', is a species of flowering plant in the wasabi genus Eutrema'', mustard family Brassicaceae. It has a nearly panarctic distribution, only absent from northern Europe, and extending to Tibet. A rhizomatous geophyte reaching , it is found in a variety of arctic and subarctic habitats; tundra, screefields, formerly glaciated hills, grassy streamsides, and peat ridges. It is an allopolyploid complex of tetraploid, hexaploid, and octaploid populations.
